key_points: Lifetime's third Harry & Meghan movie to debut on Labor Day, starring Sydney Morton and Jordan Dean.
Michele Weiss and Merideth Finn, co-executive producers, discuss reasons for recasting and creating the franchise.
Initial recasting occurred as first film actors, Parisa Fitz-Henley and Murray Fraser, became unavailable.
The production team, including director and writer, largely remained the same across movies to maintain consistency.
Casting focuses on a balance between resemblance to real-life figures and acting ability, with emphasis on unique attributes.
Weiss and Finn elaborate on adapting Harry and Meghan's public personas into relatable, robust characters for the films.
The audience's reactions to the films are as mixed as opinions about the real Harry and Meghan, with expected polarization.
The third movie addresses significant issues like racism, discrimination, and mental health.
Weiss and Finn have pursued themes of racism and discrimination consistently throughout the franchise.
Before the movies, Weiss and Finn were not extensively familiar with the details of the royal family.
